title: A Reasonable Lux Nerf
body: a couple patches back, Riot decided that for whatever reason Swain, a champion with only a ~2% pick rate who's already extremely weak in this meta should be nerfed. Swain's snare duration is now 1/1.25/1.5/1.75/2 seconds. Lux's snare on the other hand lasts 2 seconds at all levels. Swain's ranked winrate as of february 15th is 49.50% with a 1.95% pickrate while Lux's winrate is 53.49% with a 24.12% pickrate. why is it that Swain has to have his snare nerfed but not Lux? i know riot likes some champions more than others which is why their game is so fucking unbalanced right now, but i think it'd be fairly reasonable to give Lux's snare the same treatment that they gave Swain, since she's so damn strong right now.

Well, I mean. Projectile, 2 person 2-second snare.

The reason they nerfed Swain's root was because it was too oppressive with his auto-target Q/E/R. Being unable to get away from Swain meant death for a lot of champions.

Lux needs the revert on the second hit of her snare. It shouldn't deal the same damage and duration to the second target.

Swain's snare also has a delay before it actually snares. even so, i'd argue that Swain's snare is equally as difficult to land as Lux's. and though Swain can snare more people with his, the difference between Lux and Swain is that once Lux's snare is landed she can burst from a completely _safe_ distance in no more than a second, while if Swain's snare is landed he has to dive in and put himself in danger in order to properly follow up and do damage, which even then, it would take Swain over double the amount of time it'd take Lux to burst down a snared target.

edit: not to mention Lux's snare cooldown is much shorter than Swain's

Honestly, Lux needs some changes. I know its good to have champions that can go different roles, but seriously, Lux is ridiculous. She scales so well with AP, she's played mid a lot. But she has so much cc and utility, she goes supp a lot. People say she does less damage on support, and this is barely true. Most Luxes on support suffer no penalty for building like they're going mid when supporting. Everything but their gold input will be just fine, but since they just farm champions their adc can farm while they get kills/assists.

I mean, just look at how much damage Lux does when compared to champions like Lulu, or Janna. Like, just look at the kit differences. Lux has high utility normal skills, with some pretty ridiculous ratios, and a high-damage execute ult with a high range (NOTE: NOT REALLY AN ACTUAL EXECUTE). Janna and Lulu have ALL utility skills. Lulu has no moves that just do straight up damage, other than maybe Help Pix casted on an enemy, but that still gives you vision of them and moves Pix for plays. Her ult is massive utility and can give any champion an engage, but doesn't do TONS OF DAMAGE. Janna's ult is the opposite; she knocks enemies away, and HEALS allies around her. These are "normal" caster support champions. Even Morgana scales differently with support items; her burst can get a little out of control in the late game, but Lux does pretty hefty damage during the mid, late, and sometimes even early game, if she can get the kills going.

It is pointless to compare Swain's stats post-nerf and Lux's stats pre-proposed nerf in order to ask "Why was Swain nerfed and Lux isn't?". No shit Swain is weaker than Lux after his nerf, that was the whole point of him being nerfed. Obviously Lux is stronger than him right now and could probably stand to get hit herself but if you want to ask why Swain was nerfed and not her, you should be giving us his stats from before he got his root hit. What he's like now is irrelevant.

Popularity is pointless to mention anyway, he's so easy that if his popularity was as high as Lux's it'd make precisely zero difference to his win rate.
